Package models

Interface Model

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MockModel, ModelImpl
    public interface Model
    This interface represents a model. The controller of the program only interacts with this model.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addStockToPortfolio​(java.lang.String symbol, int shares)
      This method is used to create a stock and add it to this user's active portfolio.
      void createPortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName)
      This method is used to create a portfolio with a given portfolio name.
      void createUser​(java.lang.String userName, float balance)
      This method creates a user from a username and initial balance.
      java.lang.StringBuilder getComposition()
      This method is used to get the composition of this user's active portfolio.
      float getTotalValue​(java.lang.String date)
      This method is used to get the total value of this user's active portfolio on a certain date.
      void loadPortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName)
      This method is used to load a portfolio with a given portfolio name.
      void loadUser​(java.lang.String userName)
      This method loads a user from a file with the username as the file name.
      void save()
      This method is used to save this user in a file.

    • Method Detail

      • createUser

        void createUser​(java.lang.String userName,
                float balance)
        This method creates a user from a username and initial balance. This method is called which creating a user from the program.
        Parameters:
        userName - String username which is unique for a user
        balance - float balance which is entered by the user

      • loadUser

        void loadUser​(java.lang.String userName)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              java.text.ParseException
        This method loads a user from a file with the username as the file name. It loads all the data from that file into the program.
        Parameters:
        userName - String username which is unique for a user
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws an IO exception which is handled by controller
        java.text.ParseException - throws an ParseException which is handled by controller

      • createPortfolio

        void createPortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        This method is used to create a portfolio with a given portfolio name. A portfolios should have unique names for a particular user.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - String which is unique for each user

      • getTotalValue

        float getTotalValue​(java.lang.String date)
        This method is used to get the total value of this user's active portfolio on a certain date. If weekend values are govern then it tells the user to enter a date which is not weekend.
        Parameters:
        date - String which is given by the user
        Returns:
        total value of the portfolio on a certain date.

      • getComposition

        java.lang.StringBuilder getComposition()
        This method is used to get the composition of this user's active portfolio. Composition shows the symbol and number of shares of each stock in a portfolio.
        Returns:
        StringBuilder which has symbol and number of shares for each stock in portfolio

      • addStockToPortfolio

        void addStockToPortfolio​(java.lang.String symbol,
                         int shares)
        This method is used to create a stock and add it to this user's active portfolio. A portfolio contains a hashmap which stores all these stocks. To add a stock to the portfolio user needs to enter Stock Symbol and number of shares he wants.
        Parameters:
        symbol - String which should be a valid.
        shares - float which is the number of shares the user wants of that company.

      • loadPortfolio

        void loadPortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        This method is used to load a portfolio with a given portfolio name. This is called by the user to make a portfolio active and do operations like getComposition and getTotal value on a certain date.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - String which is unique for a user.

      • save

        void save()
   throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to save this user in a file. Save option is given to the user in the menu. It stores all the data into local file system.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws an IO exception is save is failed which is handled by controller
